article.headline: Seton Hall 58, Drexel 54
article.story: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Andre Sweet connected on two free throws with 27.9 seconds remaining, and Justin Cerasoli added two more with five seconds left, giving Seton Hall a 58-54 victory over Drexel Tuesday night at Continental Airlines Arena. After Drexel tied the game with 1:12 left, Seton Hall worked the ball down low to Sweet, who was fouled going to the basket. Drexel (3-5) had a chance to tie the game, but Chaz Crawford was called for an offensive foul with 11.9 seconds left. Cerasoli's free throws secured the close-call victory for the Pirates (5-3), who defeated Drexel for the fifth straight time in the series. John Allen paced Seton Hall with 12 points, while Kelly Whitney and Cerasoli added 10 each. Crawford had a game-high 19 points, and Phil Goss added 13 for Drexel. The Pirates led 30-28 at the half and seemed to take firm control in the opening minutes of the second half, scoring the first seven points after intermission. Seton Hall led by as many as 11, going up 41-30 with 13:15 left. Drexel cut the lead to 51-49 with 1:57 left on a baseline jumper by Matt Stevenson, but Whitney countered with his clutch 3-point play with 1:39 left, pushing the lead back to 54-49. Drexel tied the game at 54 on five straight free throws from Goss, setting up the last-minute heroics.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
